Desc.entry: A city-wide specialist service working with unaccompanied asylum seeker children, looked after children and careleavers within Sheffield and other parts of the county. Provision of statutory social care duties to work to maximise outcomes for looked after children and careleavers. The service has a strong developmental role both regionally and nationally and with local partners and agencies it aims to develop consistent services to support young people leaving care and through the transition to adulthood. Health professional or Social Services referral.

ProviderServiceDetails.entry: Mon-Fri 8.45am-5.15pm (office times); Tues & Fri 1.30-3.30pm, Tues 4-7.30pm (evening group), various other groups, please contact for details
